Package jibe.sdk.client.videosharing

RCSe video sharing

See:
          Description

Class Summary
VideoSharingEvent Event class, containing the event codes specific to video-sharing sessions.
VideoSharingResult A Jibe Service Result object, which gets returned by video-sharing operations.
VideoSharingService An RCS-e video-sharing service.
 

Package jibe.sdk.client.videosharing Description

RCSe video sharing

Example Code

Connecting to the Video Service

An application which will use the Video Sharing functionality must be capable of knowing when it is connected to the Jibe SDK video service. This is achieved by defining a class that implements the JibeServiceListener interface: 
import jibe.sdk.client.videosharing.VideoSharingService;

public class VideoSharingDemo extends Activity implements JibeServiceListener {

  private VideoSharingService mVideoSharingService;
  
  public void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState) {
    ...
    mVideoSharingService = new VideoSharingService(this, this);
    mVideoSharingService.connect();
  }
        
  public void handleServiceConnected(String serviceClassName) {
    ...
    if (serviceClassName.equals(VideoSharingService.class.getName())) {
          if (mIncomingSessionId > 0) {
        mBtnAccept.setEnabled(true);
      }
    }
  }

Receiving Video Sharing Events

The Jibe SDK generates Video Sharing events to indicate the state of an active video session. (Note a new incoming Video Sharing invite is delivered via an Intent). Before using the Video Sharing Service, an application must also register to receive Video Sharing events: 
import jibe.sdk.client.videosharing.VideoSharingEvent;

public class VideoSharingDemo extends Activity implements JibeServiceListener {

  public void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState) {
    ...
    mEventService = new JibeEventService(this, this);
    mEventService.connect();
  }
  
  public void handleServiceConnected(String serviceClassName) {
    ...
    if (serviceClassName.equals(JibeEventService.class.getName())) {
      try {
        mEventService.subscribe(JibeEvent.Category.VIDEOSHARING, jibeEventListener);
      } catch (JibeServiceException e) {
        e.printStackTrace();
      }
  }

Initiating a Video Share

Receiving a Video Session

The Jibe SDK sends an Android Intent to an application when a new incoming video share request is received. An application which wishes to handle video sharing request must register to receive these Intents: 
<receiver android:name=".VideoSharingReceiver">
  <intent-filter>
    <action android:name="jibe.intent.action.incomingVideo"/>
  </intent-filter>
</receiver>
The application must then implement a BroadcastReceiver class which will receive the Intent. 
public class VideoSharingReceiver extends BroadcastReceiver {

  public void onReceive(Context context, Intent intent) {
    Intent mIntent = new Intent();
  
    mIntent.setClass(context, VideoSharingDemo.class);
    mIntent.setFlags(Intent.FLAG_ACTIVITY_NEW_TASK);
    mIntent.putExtra(JibeIntents.EXTRA_SESSION_ID, intent.getLongExtra(JibeIntents.EXTRA_SESSION_ID, 0));
    mIntent.putExtra(JibeIntents.EXTRA_COMMUNITYID, intent.getIntExtra(JibeIntents.EXTRA_COMMUNITYID, 0));
    mIntent.putExtra(JibeIntents.EXTRA_USERID, intent.getStringExtra(JibeIntents.EXTRA_USERID));
    mIntent.putExtra(JibeIntents.EXTRA_RAWCONTACTID, intent.getLongExtra(JibeIntents.EXTRA_RAWCONTACTID, 0));

    context.startActivity(mIntent);
  }
}
An application which wishes to receive video sharing sessions must provide a surface for the incoming video stream to be rendered to. The Jibe SDK provides jibe.sdk.client.videosharing.VideoRenderer and jibe.sdk.client.videosharing.VideoSurfaceView classes to support this: 
import jibe.sdk.client.videosharing.VideoRenderer;
import jibe.sdk.client.videosharing.VideoSurfaceView;

public class VideoSharingDemo extends Activity implements JibeServiceListener {
  ...
  private VideoSurfaceView mRemoteViewSurface;
        
  public void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState) {
    ...
        mRemoteViewSurface = (VideoSurfaceView) findViewById(R.id.video_remote);
        mVideoRenderer = new VideoRenderer(mRemoteViewSurface);
  }
The application will now receive an Intent when a video sharing request arrives. 
protected void onNewIntent(Intent intent) {
  mIncomingSessionId = intent.getLongExtra(JibeIntents.EXTRA_SESSION_ID, 0);
  mEditUri.setText(intent.getStringExtra(JibeIntents.EXTRA_USERID));
  
  if (mIncomingSessionId > 0)
        mBtnAccept.setEnabled(true);
}
If the user wants to accept the incoming video sharing request then it will call the following: 
private void acceptVideoSharing() {
  if (mIncomingSessionId <= 0)
    return;
    
    try {
      VideoSharingResult result = mVideoSharingService.acceptVideoSharingSession(mIncomingSessionId, mVideoRenderer);
      
      if (result.succeeded()) {
        mBtnAccept.setEnabled(false);
        mBtnClose.setEnabled(true);
      }
    } catch (JibeServiceException e) {
      e.printStackTrace();
      Toast.makeText(this, e.getMessage(), Toast.LENGTH_SHORT).show();
    }
}
If the user does not want to accept the video sharing session then the application will call this code:
